result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin Allen Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds. Balance as condition of Extended Supervision.  To be paid by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegally controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay mandatory DNA surcharge, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Allen Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  /dds

*copy forwarded to parties*
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, calendar successor, for review. mag
Count two.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. 

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 42 months with 279 days credit - concurrent with 11cf6060 -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 24 months; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. o3.  Request of Substitution received and filed.  Court denies request for substitution.  It is ineffective under the statute.

Attorney Parr contacted the Court indicating he is ill and has been for a number of weeks.  Attorney Parr requests an adjournment.  Attorney Parr indicated he notified ADA Murphy to let him know an adjournment was being requested.
Defendant's revocation summary, received and filed.  aw
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.  Case adjourned for sentencing to allow the court to speak with the defendant's agent.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 3/4/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received a new offer, and requests time for the defendant to review the offer, and to contact the defendant's probation officer.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 1/9/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  Defendant to remain in Milwaukee County custody, and not sent back to prison.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 1/7/2015 at 8:30 am, and for jury trial on 2/23/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw

Note:  Case was set for jury trial on Mr. Murphy's charging week in which he agreed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.
Attorney Parr called and informed the court that he has the flu and unable to appear.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 12/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Letter and papers from Cheif Deputy District Attorney, Kent Lovern stating the defendant requests a prompt disposition.  Letter and papers received and filed.  aw

Attorney Gregory R. Parr in court, defendant Marvin Allen Smith not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense informs court that defendant's location is House of Correction.    Any Motions must be filed by next court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory R. Parr in court, defendant Marvin Allen Smith not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel does not know where the defendant is.  Court contacted the defendant's agent, and states he is in custody.  Attorney Parr to find where his client is, and inform the court on the next court date.  Court also allows case 14cf1400 and 14cf1401 to be severed.  Court orders all motions filed by the next court date.  Case adjourned for 11/14/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory R. Parr in court, defendant Marvin Allen Smith not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to file a motion for severernce.  Court orders defense counsel to file any other motions he has by 10/9/2014.  Case adjourned for status on 10/31/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's response to defense motion to dismiss and suppress, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Gregory R. Parr in court, defendant Marvin Allen Smith not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.
Defense counsel wishes to join in on the co-defendant's motion.  State to respond by 9/10/2014.  Defense to file any response to states response by 9/17/2014.  Defense counsel plans to file a motion to sever.  Case adjourned for status on 9/26/14 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory R. Parr in court, defendant Marvin Allen Smith not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense needs time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/20/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT (15 pages) commencing JULY 21, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in court with attorney Gregory R. Parr.  Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in custody.  William Levins for Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Matthew Bell.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Marvin Allen Smith in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marvin Allen Smith
Current: 3327 W MICHIGAN AVE, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 07-10-2014)
Prior: 1137 South 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Marvin Allen Smith not in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6-6-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
